data.title: Henry V
data.meta_description: Performed by a single company of 25 actors, this three-play event will immerse audiences in Shakespeare’s examination of power, those who seek it and those who are destroyed by the power they crave.
data.text:
William Shakespeare

Playwright

Joseph Haj

Director

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

Joseph Haj

GUTHRIE Artistic Director since 2015; Hamlet, A Christmas Carol, Dickens’ Holiday Classic, The Glass Menagerie, Cyrano de Bergerac (Adapter/Director), West Side Story, Romeo and Juliet, Sunday in the Park With George, King Lear, South Pacific, Pericles. THEATER As an actor and director, Haj has worked at many of the nation’s foremost theaters, including The Public Theater, Alley Theatre, Mark Taper Forum, Actors Theatre of Louisville, Folger Theatre and Oregon Shakespeare Festival as well as in Japan, Paris, Salzburg, Berlin, Edinburgh, the West Bank and Gaza. He is an original member of SITI Company, a former member of the Guthrie’s acting company and the former Producing Artistic Director of PlayMakers Rep (2006–2015). AWARDS White House Millennial Grant; Zelda Fichandler Award; Rosetta LeNoire Award

Jan Chambers

Scenic Designer

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

Jan Chambers

GUTHRIE Hamlet, Cyrano de Bergerac, Sunday in the Park With George, Pericles. THEATER Folger Theatre: Pericles, Hamlet; PlayMakers Rep (Resident Set and Costume Designer): Fat Ham, They Do Not Know Harlem (premiere), Skeleton Crew, Leaving Eden (premiere), Red, The Tempest, Metamorphoses, The Making of a King: Henry IV and Henry V, Fences, Angels in America, Nicholas Nickleby, Topdog/Underdog and Pericles, among others; Oregon Shakespeare Festival: Pericles, Henry V; Archipelago Theatre/Ciné (Resident Set and Costume Designer): North: A Love Letter, It Had Wings, The Reckoning, The Narrowing, Blue Roses, Eulogy for a Warrior, Ten in One, Those Women

Trevor Bowen

Costume Designer

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

Trevor Bowen

GUTHRIE Shane, Hamlet, We Are Proud To Present…, Choir Boy. THEATER Twin Cities: Walker Art Center; The Cowles Center; MN Opera; Ordway; Children’s Theatre Company; Park Square Theatre; Ten Thousand Things; History Theatre; Penumbra Theatre; Mixed Blood; Jungle Theater; Pillsbury House Theatre; Regional: The Color Purple (Denver Center); The Day You Begin (The Kennedy Center); Ride the Cyclone (Arena Stage); pen/man/ship (Contemporary American Theater Festival); The Miraculous Journey of Edward Tulane (Seattle Children’s Theatre); Ragtime (5th Avenue Theatre); Sweat (Asolo Rep); BLKS, True West (Steppenwolf); Bluebeard’s Castle/Four Songs (Boston Lyric Opera). www.trevorbowendesign.com

Heather Gilbert

Lighting Designer

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

Heather Gilbert

GUTHRIE Debut. THEATER Broadway: Parade (Drama Desk Award nomination, Tony Award nomination); The Sound Inside (Drama Desk Award, Outer Critics Circle recognition, Tony Award nomination); Regional: Steppenwolf; Goodman Theatre; Center Theatre Group; The Muny; Williamstown Theatre Festival; Oregon Shakespeare Festival. TEACHING Head of Lighting Design, Columbia College Chicago. TRAINING M.F.A., The Theatre School at DePaul University

Mikaal Sulaiman

Sound Designer

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

Mikaal Sulaiman

GUTHRIE The History Plays, A Christmas Carol. THEATER Broadway: Doubt, An Enemy of the People, Fat Ham, The Thanksgiving Play, Death of a Salesman, Cost of Living, Macbeth, Thoughts of a Colored Man; Off-Broadway: Watch Night (Perelman Performing Arts Center); The Half-God of Rainfall, Sanctuary City (NYTW); Fairview (Soho Rep); Underground Railroad Game (Ars Nova); Skittles Commercial: The Broadway Musical. AWARDS Obie Award; AUDELCO Award; Henry Hewes Award; Creative Capital Award; Nominations: Tony Award; Drama Desk Award; Lucille Lortel Award; San Francisco Bay Area Theatre Critics Circle Award; Theatre Bay Area Award. www.mikaal.com

Jack Herrick

Composer

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

Jack Herrick

GUTHRIE Hamlet, The Glass Menagerie, Cyrano de Bergerac, Pericles. THEATER Broadway: Fool Moon; Off-Broadway: A Lie of the Mind, Wilder, Lone Star Love, Big Apple Circus; Regional: Folger Theatre; Ford’s Theatre; Oregon Shakespeare Festival; The Rep; Great River Shakespeare Festival; PlayMakers Rep; International: A Child’s Christmas in Wales (Wales Theatre Company/Altonaer Theater). AWARDS Tony Award (Fool Moon); Kevin Kline Award (Bah! Humbug!); Artistic Director and Performer in The Red Clay Ramblers. www.redclayramblers.bandcamp.com, www.redclayramblers.com

Carla Steen

Resident Dramaturg

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

Carla Steen

GUTHRIE More than 85 productions since 1996; Musicals include Into the Woods, Guys and Dolls, West Side Story, Sunday in the Park With George, The Cocoanuts, The Pirates of Penzance, Martin Guerre and Sweeney Todd. THEATER Dramaturgy: The Acting Company; University of Minnesota/Guthrie Theater B.F.A. Acting Program; Hammerstein Center; NYU Tisch School of the Arts; Augsburg University. PROFESSIONAL AFFILIATIONS Member of Literary Managers and Dramaturgs of the Americas (LMDA). TRAINING M.F.A., Columbia University; B.A., Augsburg University

Sara Becker

Vocal Coach

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

Sara Becker

GUTHRIE Romeo and Juliet, Henry V. THEATER Regional: 15 seasons and over 30 plays with American Players Theatre where she is Director of Voice and Text; Hamlet, As You Like It and others at Oregon Shakespeare Festival; PlayMakers Rep; Alley Theatre; Brooklyn Academy of Music; ACT Contemporary Theatre (Seattle); Milwaukee Rep; Colorado Shakespeare Festival; Clarence Brown Theatre. TEACHING Endowed Professor of Shakespeare and Voice, UNC School of the Arts. TRAINING M.F.A., University of Wisconsin-Madison (with Susan Sweeney)

U. Jonathan Toppo

Fight Director

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

U. Jonathan Toppo

U. Jonathan Toppo also serves as the Fight Director for the History Plays.

CAST

GUTHRIE West Side Story, Pericles. THEATER Northumberland/Glendower in Henry IV, Part I, Boult/Ensemble in Pericles (Folger Shakespeare Theatre); Roger Ackroyd/Inspector Ragland in Murder of Roger Ackroyd (Oregon Cabaret Theater); Over 30 seasons at Oregon Shakespeare Festival, including Tilney in Shakespeare in Love, Bardolph in The Merry Wives of Windsor, Green in Richard II, Fortinbras in A Wrinkle in Time, Steve Hubbell in A Streetcar Named Desire, Pistol in Henry V, Monsieur de Bonnefoi in The Imaginary Invalid and Sir Walter Blunt in Henry IV, Part I. TEACHING Adjunct Faculty, Southern Oregon University; Associate Instructor, Dueling Arts International. www.ujonathantoppo.com

CREATIVE

GUTHRIE West Side Story,Pericles.THEATER Broadway: Sweat (Studio 54); Regional: Sweat (The Public Theater); Angels in America (Berkeley Rep); Mojada (Portland Center Stage); The Pirates of Penzance (Portland Opera); All the Way (Seattle Rep); Oregon Shakespeare Festival: Resident Fight Director since 2007, including Othello, Oklahoma!, Romeo and Juliet, Henry V, Julius Caesar, Shakespeare in Love, Hamlet, Richard II, Richard III, Guys and Dolls, Fingersmith, Into the Woods, A Streetcar Named Desire and King Lear. AWARDS Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Fight Choreography (Sweat, The Public Theater). www.ujonathantoppo.com

Karl Alphonso

Stage Manager

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

Karl Alphonso

GUTHRIE Dial M for Murder, The Importance of Being Earnest, Murder on the Orient Express, Blues for an Alabama Sky, Sally & Tom, Sweat. THEATER Oregon Shakespeare Festival (14 seasons, selected): Stage Manager: Mother Road, The Book of Will, Manahatta, UniSon, Vietgone, The Happiest Song Plays Last; Assistant Stage Manager: A Midsummer Night’s Dream, Shakespeare in Love, Fingersmith, The Liquid Plain, Party People, The Pirates of Penzance, American Night, The White Snake; Iowa Summer Rep (2006–2007); QTP India (2001–2005). TRAINING M.F.A., Theatre, The University of Iowa; M.A., University of Mumbai

Tree O'Halloran

Stage Manager

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

Tree O'Halloran

GUTHRIE Stage Manager: Hamlet, Emma, Floyd’s, A Christmas Carol, An Enemy of the People, Blithe Spirit, King Lear, Sense and Sensibility, The Cocoanuts, The Events, Juno and the Paycock, A Midsummer Night’s Dream, The Cocktail Hour, The Heidi Chronicles, Our Country’s Good, An Iliad, Nice Fish, Appomattox, The Edge of Our Bodies, Circle Mirror Transformation, Pericles; Assistant Stage Manager: South Pacific, Othello, Born Yesterday, Long Day’s Journey Into Night, The Illusion, The Tempest, Medea, The Front Page. THEATER Hartford Stage; Alley Theatre; Children’s Theatre Company; Williamstown Theatre Festival; Jungle Theater; Illusion Theater; Ordway; PlayMakers Rep; Italy: T.S.E., G.A. Story

Jason Clusman

Assistant Stage Manager

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

Jason Clusman

GUTHRIE Stage Manager/Assistant Stage Manager: Nearly 50 productions, most recently including the History Plays, A Christmas Carol and Shane. THEATER History Theatre; Ten Thousand Things; Theater Latté Da; The Moving Company; Shapiro & Smith Dance; Quicksilver Productions; Three Legged Race Productions; Playwrights’ Center; Penumbra Theatre; Minnesota Centennial Showboat; Walker Art Center: Ocean. OTHER North Star Events, including implementing COVID-19 testing and vaccination efforts for the state of Minnesota and 2023 inauguration events for Governor Tim Walz and Lt. Governor Peggy Flanagan. TRAINING B.A., University of Minnesota

Olivia Louise Tree Plath

Assistant Stage Manager

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

Olivia Louise Tree Plath

GUTHRIE Hamlet, Sally & Tom, Sweat, Noura. THEATER Notre Dame Shakespeare Festival; Cleveland Play House; Dorset Theatre Festival; Yale Repertory Theatre. FILM/TELEVISION The Theatre Downstream: The Lemonade Jamboree, The Hepburn Girls, No Lost Cause. AWARDS Dexter Wood Luke Memorial Prize. TRAINING M.F.A., Stage Management, David Geffen School of Drama at Yale University

Lavina Jadhwani

Associate Director

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

Lavina Jadhwani

GUTHRIE Adapter: A Christmas Carol; Director: As You Like It. THEATER Directing: Much Ado About Nothing (PlayMakers Rep); Peter and the Starcatcher (Oregon Shakespeare Festival); House of Joy (The Rep); Gloria (Mixed Blood); Roe, The Cake (Asolo Rep); Writing (selected): Goodman Theatre; The Gift Theatre; East West Players; Oregon Shakespeare Festival; Cincinnati Shakespeare Festival; Indianapolis Shakespeare Festival; Serves on the boards of the National New Play Network and The Chicago Inclusion Project. TRAINING M.F.A., The Theatre School at DePaul University; B.F.A./M.A., Carnegie Mellon University. www.lavinajadhwani.com

Annie Enneking

Intimacy

Henry V

Wurtele Thrust

Close Calendar Exit Icon

Annie Enneking

GUTHRIE Skeleton Crew, the History Plays, A Raisin in the Sun. THEATER Fight Direction: She Kills Monsters, Troilus and Cressida (UMN); Man of La Mancha, Cabaret (Theater Latté Da); Hand to God, Noises Off (Jungle Theater); Of Mice and Men, Cyrano (Park Square Theatre); Cambodian Rock Band, Man of God (Theater Mu); Antigonick, Anon(ymous) (Full Circle); Hamlet, Macbeth (Shakespearean Youth Theatre); Intimacy Direction: Extremities, Fool for Love (Dark & Stormy Productions); Bernhardt/Hamlet (Theatre Pro Rata); Life Sucks (Girl Friday). MUSIC Founder of the band Annie and the Big Bang. TEACHING Stage Violence, University of Minnesota. AWARDS Grants: MSAB; MRAC; Jerome Foundation; 2010 McKnight Theater Artist Fellowship

Jennifer Liestman

Resident Casting Director
